name: pyqstem

pre_pr_migrator_status.python39:
not solvable: ['linux_64_numpy1.19python3.9.____cpython: Encountered problems while solving.
Problem: package numpy-1.9.3-py27h7e35acb_3 requires python >=2.7,<2.8.0a0, but none of the providers can be installed
', 'osx_64_numpy1.19python3.9.____cpython: Encountered problems while solving.
Problem: package numpy-1.9.3-py27hb3dd696_3 requires python >=2.7,<2.8.0a0, but none of the providers can be installed
', 'win_64_numpy1.19python3.9.____cpython: Encountered problems while solving.
Problem: package numpy-1.11.3-py27hab9e983_3 requires python >=2.7,<2.8.0a0, but none of the providers can be installed
']

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "pyqstem" %}
{% set version = "1.0.3" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 612c4c95531ea9239c91e6f8b9e29a954ac873dd8584b6a57512dcfb6263ff0a
  patches:
    - Remove-unused-scipy-import-leading-to-crashes.patch

build:
  number: 5
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"
  skip: True  # [py<35]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
  host:
    - cython
    - fftw
    - numpy
    - python
    - pip
  run:
    - ase
    - fftw
    - matplotlib-base
    - {{ pin_compatible('numpy') }}
    - python
    - scikit-image
    - scipy

test:
  imports:
    - pyqstem
    - pyqstem.util
    - pyqstem.potentials
    
about:
    description: 'QSTEM is a program for quantitative image simulation in
        electron microscopy, including TEM, STEM and CBED image simulation.

        This project interfaces the QSTEM code with Python and the
        Atomic Simulation Environment (ASE) to provide a single
        environment for building models, simulating and analysing
        images.

        '
    dev_url: https://github.com/jacobjma/PyQSTEM
    doc_url: https://github.com/jacobjma/PyQSTEM
    home: https://github.com/jacobjma/PyQSTEM
    license: GPLv3
    license_file: License.txt
    summary: A Python interface to the electron microscopy simulation program QSTEM.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - schiotz
    - jacobjma
